data.title: Revert "add custom selection sizes to aid the renderer" on prep-1512
data.body:
This reverts commit c3dce785a54637301b941206fadbcd28271b499b.

Works around #10070 on the prep branch only, bringing this back to how it was in the last few releases (yes - we did always show the move-blocked cursor over the bridge ends!).  The proper fix for Next + 1 is #10118.

data.title: Missiles need some fine adjusting
data.body:
The `Missile` enhancements that have gone in since the past release have been awesome and needed, but at the same time they beefed up missiles in all mods. I'm not proposing any code changes to the missiles, only yaml tweaks to get them back/similar to their release version states. **I'm also thinking TS is fine as-is, and this ticket applies only for RA, TD, and D2K**. We had received negative feedback in RA on this during a playtest, can't speak for other mods yet or if it's a concern there.

I have an automated RA test map here https://github.com/cjshmyr/OpenRA/commit/f941a0ed7f58f4fd184258f02ad38dce6893b5f2 that runs on both bleed and release. It should be useful when comparing the two, also when applying any balance changes back to bleed.

I've observed the following for RA:
- E3 anti-air is better
- Mammoth anti-air is better
- Destroyers all-around are better
- E3 and Chronotank land targeting seems unaffected

Not yet checked SAM sites.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28672342-missiles-need-some-fine-adjusting?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Upgrade Checks Changes
Map editor doesn't set Creeps' enemies
data.body:
Creating a new map with a player results in yaml like such:

```
Players:
    PlayerReference@Neutral:
        Name: Neutral
        OwnsWorld: True
        NonCombatant: True
        Faction: england
    PlayerReference@Creeps:
        Name: Creeps
        NonCombatant: True
        Faction: england
    PlayerReference@Multi0:
        Name: Multi0
        Playable: True
        Faction: Random
        Enemies: Creeps
```

Missing `Enemies: Multi0` for Creeps

data.title: Speed up FrozenUnderFog.Tick
data.body:
Two speedups here:
- Avoid the perf impact of accessing Lazy<T>.Value for the traits.
- Store states for each player in an array rather than a dictionary for much faster lookups. This relies on the players in the world never changing (they don't once the world is created) - however I have applied a small refactoring to firm this up a bit.

On the RA shellmap, this reduces total CPU time spent in FrozenUnderFog.Tick from 1.40% to 0.51%.

data.title: Updated to current version from Eluant fork
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9142. See https://github.com/OpenRA/Eluant/pull/1 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9978.

data.title: Cannot override rules from a parent/required mod.
data.body:
We don't merge rules defined in `mod.yaml` as they are seen as rules belonging to _this_ mod regardless of filepath (because obviously mods don't care about paths in that way).

cc @penev92, @pchote

I think the way to remedy this situation is:
- `mod.yaml` inheritance which will naturally pull in all of the files in the parent mod
- merge any rule files (weapons, art, rules, etc) as the _last_ step in mod rule loading so anything defined in this mod (ra-ns for example) would be merged instead of marked as a duplicate

        ra: Red Alert (git-3e8df55)
        ra-ns: Red Alert - No Superweapons (alpha-0.1)
        ts: Tiberian Sun (git-3e8df55)

data.title: Repair all building hotkey.
data.body: I think mabye we can make a hotkey that can repair all building once you use it, because some time my building was get place too close on each other, that make me a difficult to see which building a damaged and which one don't, so if we can make this hotkey working, we may be much quickly to avoid some unnecessary building get destroyed just because those life bar a too close to each other.

data.title: Fix some spellings
Fix broken GPS and frozen actor behaviour
data.body:
## Merge dictionaries in GpsDot

This speeds up GpsDot.Tick as it requires only one dictionary lookup per player rather than two. This change also provides useful infrastructure for later commits.

On the RA shellmap, this reduces total CPU time spent in GpsDot.Tick from 1.3% to 0.6%.
## Ensure frozen actors are rendered on the first tick they become visible

Fixes a regression from #7734. If we don't render the snapshot for the frozen actor straight away, the actor can continue ticking and we'll take a much newer than intended snapshot and display that instead. This doesn't tend to have bad effects in practise but nonetheless we revert back to using TickRender to get a snapshot at the correct time.

We still manage to keep the perf benefit of #7734, by only rendering the snapshot once and not again until we need to.
## Fix GPS dot relying on frozen actor render state

Fixes #10155. See the linked issue for more details. Ultimately I have seperated the simulation and render state of the GPS dot from the frozen actor rendering. I have attempted to maintain other behaviour, such as not rendering a GPS dot if there is already a visible frozen actor for it.
## Fix GPS refreshing for incorrect player

This was just noticed during the debugging for #10155 as clearly broken behaviour (relying on the render player in simulation code). I'm including a fix here, although we haven't seen this manifest any issues of its own as yet.
## Please review carefully

So far, every PR I have ever submitted or reviewed dealing with the frozen actor code has contained major regressions which I did not catch. Anything I've written here has a high chance of being super broken and you should treat it with due scepticism.

data.title: Interleave renderables for effects and actors
data.body:
Previously, renderables from actors were z-ordered, but effects were excluded and not ordered. Now we order them all as a whole.

For reference, the RA shellmap uses ~450 actors and ~330 effects at a given moment. Sorting just the actors alone costs 1.4% CPU, whilst sorting both actors and effects raises it to 1.8%. So the performance impact isn't too bad.

According to https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9443#issue-108459573, this will hopefully fix some polish issues.

data.title: Rework order targeting crazyness.
data.body:
Reduces some duplication in UnitOrderGenerator and fixes #10070.  As a side effect, this adds the other half of the plumbing we need to fix #7546 (#9800 adds the first half), and gets us a small step closer to #8917.
#10070 was introduced by #9327 which gave them a finite selection size.  This meant that the ScreenMap query for actors under the cursor now returned the bridge actor instead of null, and meant that the move cursor and order queries checked against the actor's center position instead of the moused over cell.

This fix comes in two parts:
1. Adding a second pass to `UnitOrderGenerator.OrderForUnit` that checks for orders against the cell if there are no valid orders against the actor.
2. Making move orders invalid for any non-cell targets.

This fixes the cursor, and allows us to again order actors to any cell in the bridge footprint.  It also fixes the inconsistency where you got a move cursor when mousing over trees, but not over barrels.

This may have unexpected consequences, so it shouldn't be merged to prep:
- If there are any cases that relied on move orders against actors being valid when the moused-over cell was invalid but the actor's center position was valid (I don't think we have any code _this_ bogus... although it might affect crushing)
- If there are any other where we want to prevent orders against cells when there is an un-targetable actor on top.

data.title: Try to speed the frozen actor layer checks up
data.body:
by not creating frozen actors for players that don't need them.

Not sure if it gives us that much, though.

data.title: self-defense spy?
data.body:
Ok, I have few idea about the allies spy, I was thinking we already set every unit on a defend mode already, why not let the spy has the same mode that can choose? when spy a not in disguise, they will automatic shoot any enemy unit nearby if they reach the fire range, and change on hold fire mode if it on disguise, so if you can doing that, then the allies can finally have a anit-spy unit that can protect not to get stole, because you spy will kill any disguise enemy spy on side.

data.title: defend mode problems.
data.body: So, I know on the new version, the unit was normally on a defend mode, so that was good to let them not to chaseing enemy away, but there is problem, some time they will stay on postition and don't attack the enemy that was on range, and will take damage till died, I have this situation a lot time, once my rocket soldier with the rifleman was attacking the enemy tanks, and the soldier on behind suddenly stanting there doing nothing but takeing hit and died, before they died, I was check they moveing line, which it's still on a red attacking line, but still standing there not fight back, this was a really big problems, especially when you control a huge group on battle, most of them just stay behind getting shot at... each game has a same problems.

data.title: Grenadier self destruction damage a way too high...
data.body:
So, I found a really big problem about the grenadier, on both red alert and dune 2000, because those grenadier self destruction damage a way too high, which it will kill almost every friendly infantry nearby, most the time the grenadier is with other infantry on combat, and they are going way too front, make them get killed on the frist place, and even worst, if many of them stay together, it will cause chain reaction, make them blow up almost half you infantry group, is way too high on the damage, and most the time they will get killed without even reach the thorwing range or before throwing the grenade, because those problem, the grenadier is become almost useless, almost useless on the crazy ivan on the red alert 2.

data.title: Engineers should have a lower selectable priority
data.body:
When mixed with a group and attack moved, engineers just run straight at the target.

An argument could be made for mechs / medics too but when they attack move with a group they usually stop to heal friendlies so generally move with the group. I don't think it is as much of an issue.

Thoughts?

data.title: Power tooltip
data.body:
I added information about using power in tooltip.

I don't know it is good idea or not.
It is my first experience in OpenRa.

data.title: Animations tick inside rendering functions
data.body:
Some areas call Animation.Tick from inside rendering functions instead of tick functions. This means the animation is tied to the framerate rather than the world time. This may lead to some animations becoming out of sync with the apparent world state.

Offending callsites are:
- [x] [WithDecoration](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/da1485dab7e168be004f51bcf73046d5692822ef/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Render/WithDecoration.cs#L167)
- [x] [WithParachute](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/da1485dab7e168be004f51bcf73046d5692822ef/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Render/WithParachute.cs#L149)
- [x] [Carryall](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/da1485dab7e168be004f51bcf73046d5692822ef/OpenRA.Mods.D2k/Traits/Carryall.cs#L208)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28613678-animations-tick-inside-rendering-functions?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Removed StyleCop dependency for unit tests
data.body: We are currently enforcing the full StyleCop dependency on everyone who wants to run unit tests as in the `%check` section of an RPM package https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8264. This is stupid, but easily resolved.

data.title: drop target which was created from autotarget if targeted actor now p

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
revents autotarget. This is an improvement on the changes made with PR #9854 to resolve issue #6170.

This addresses the scenarios described by @r34ch 4 days ago:

> 1. If a unit is attacking a building and then a friendly engineer starts capturing it, that unit will not stop attacking until ordered to move; with the exception of
> 2. turreted units will continue to attack the building being captured even when moved, including moving out of range and back into range.

data.title: Charge animation for ts obelisk is missing / hidden
data.body: http://gfycat.com/OrderlyBetterBasil

data.title: debug in VS 2015
data.body:
How are you able to debug the code using Visual Studio  2015? When I try the game take over the whole screen and I am unable to use the breakpoints. 

It be good to be able to use the breakpoint so I would be able to step though the flow of the game and make it more easy to debug error / code in the game. 

Is there any way to make the game only take part of the screen and be able to use breakpoint ?

data.title: Polished the Windows installer
data.body:
Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10102.

You now can't de-select "Game" and I got rid of the unnecessary sub-section to avoid a horizontal scroll bar on modern Windows themes as depicted in the screenshot as well.

data.title: Fix D2K outpost artwork offsets and selection box.
data.body: Fixes #8504.  Another simple fix to make the overhauled D2K mod extra polished for the nit-picky original game fans.

data.title: Fix the D2K building selection decorations
data.body:
![tags](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/11383715/1d7ff6fe-9302-11e5-9719-5b1c910d85ae.png)

This adds new "Primary Building" tag artwork for D2K (the original game repurposed the control group display, which doesn't work for us since we support grouped buildings), and implements the upgraded building decoration that the green star is supposed to be used for.

This is a simple pr that fixes a long standing polish annoyance, so i'd like to see this merged to prep.

The `WithDecoration:SelectionDecoration` option will be used in a future PR to generalize our horrible hardcoded tag and control group rendering.  This also provides our first shipped example of the global upgrades code.

data.title: Fix the ConvertSpriteToPngCommand.
You can actually install the OpenRA shortcut without installing OpenRA
data.body:
Is it possible to check and disable the Game checkbox in the installer ?

![meh](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/11383093/299a0c0a-9306-11e5-8ad5-b908557f3d7b.png)

IMHO only _real players_ are able to play with the shortcut only. :trollface:

data.title: Game crash when replay is selected in the wrong mod
data.body:
I wanted to watch the replay named BTT2015-51.orarep (RA replay) so I copied it, went into my Documents\OpenRA\Replays folder, spam-clicked the first line in the Windows explorer (so the first alphabetical folder was cnc), pasted the replay there, started OpenRA (CNC mod running), Extras, Replays, and when I selected this replay the game crashed with

```
Tiberian Dawn Mod at Version release-20150919
on map b0f941e404b8113179ed8c358982f99d3b1021c5 (shellmap by Chris Forbes).
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.ArgumentException`: Sprite flags/ukraine was not found.
    OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.ImageWidget.Draw()
    OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter()
    OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter()
    OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.ScrollPanelWidget.DrawOuter()
    OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter()
    OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter()
    OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter()
    OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter()
    OpenRA.Game.RenderTick()
    OpenRA.Game.Loop()
    OpenRA.Game.Run()
    OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
    OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

This seems logical but the game could display a dialog box or load the corresponding mod instead.

In the other hand, if you select the CNC mod in OpenRA before exiting OpenRA, and if you load this replay by double clicking the orarep file then OpenRA will start, load the RA mod and play the replay. :+1: 
Finally, pasting the replay in the directory with the right mod but not the right version (playtest-20151114 instead of release-20150919) leads to an "Incompatible Replay" dialog box. :+1:
